measured_by: Basketball jump-shot Go/No-Go task with LED-triggered shot-vs-pass choice
justification: The authors describe the experimental task as “a Go/No-Go procedure … that includes a change in the movement itself, from shooting to passing,” and state that it was used “to examine the parallel preparation of the two movements,” i.e., real-time decision-making.

topic_or_construct: Parallel movement preparation (serial vs. parallel information processing)
measured_by: Success-rate curves across LED delay conditions (0–70 % of hang-time) in the jump-shot task
justification: They argue that “if the success rate of the pass trial reaches zero … the change … is considered to have been made simply by continuous (serial) revision,” whereas sustained success “demonstrated parallel preparation,” so the success-rate measure operationalises parallel processing.

measured_by: Individualised LED illumination delays derived from force-plate-measured hang-time
justification: LED onset times were “strictly controlled … divided into eight conditions (0–70 %)” using each player’s pre-measured hang-time, specifically to probe “the reaction time for making a decision … when the objective changes for a movement that has already been initiated.”
